Strings.S: Disable low health indicator during cutscenes
Always launch game using best graphics settings
Sets the screen mode for the game.

Creates a window border for the game. Requires ScreenMode = 1. Note: The game's windowed resolution must not be close to or exactly the same as your display's width and/or height, otherwise the border will not appear. This is a safety measure to ensure the border doesn't get lost outside of your display area.
Hides the low health indicator during cutscenes, which would otherwise be distracting as the cutscenes play out.

Disables the low health indicator completely. Note: Enabling this option is only recommended if you are using a controller with vibration enabled. Otherwise, you have no way of knowing when you're low on health unless you check the inventory screen.
Adjusts the grain size of the noise filter.

Adds compatibility for the Image Enhancement Pack to have its visuals display correctly. Must be enabled if using the Image Enhancement Pack. Requires Fix2D = 1. Fit: Displays the images without any cropping. Fill: Scales images to fill the display area, removing any letterboxes or pillarboxes, up to a 16:9 aspect ratio. Auto: Automatically displays the images depending on aspect ratio.

Adds compatibility for the FMV Enhancement Pack to have its videos display correctly in various modes. Fit: Displays the FMVs without any cropping. Fill: Scales FMVs to fill the display area, removing any letterboxes or pillarboxes, up to a 16:9 aspect ratio. Auto: Automatically displays the FMVs depending on aspect ratio.
Removes in-game cutscene letterboxing. Note: It is recommended to enable this if playing in a widescreen aspect ratio.

Cutscenes will be zoomed in to match their original 4:3 horizontal compositions when playing in widescreen. This will hide "frozen" character models that have been loaded in, right outside the 4:3 boundaries, ready and waiting to enter the scene. Note: This feature will zoom up to a 16:9 aspect ratio. It will not zoom past this aspect ratio as too much of the composition would be cropped otherwise.
Enables all advanced graphics settings from the option's menu (complex fog, shadows, lens flare, etc) by default upon each game launch.
Run the game in DirectX 9 (required to use shaders below)
Converts the game from DirectX 8 to DirectX 9, allowing for additional features and fixes to be used. Note: Must be enabled to use shaders.
Adjusts the color temperature of the overall game image to give it a slight cool tint.
Enables subpixel morphological anti-aliasing (SMAA). Note: It is recommended to disable this if using GPU-based anti-aliasing.
Restores the ability to adjust the brightness level in the game's options menu, regardless if playing in windowed or fullscreen mode.
Detects every resolution your display offers and makes them selectable choices in the game's options menu, along with displaying their respective aspect ratios.
Enables the SH2 Widescreen Fixes Pack and sh2proxy module. Note: If disabled, various other features/fixes will also be disabled.
Set the game to run at a specific, manual width. Note: The dynamic resolution feature must be disabled for a manual resolution to take effect.
Set the game to run at a specific, manual height. Note: The dynamic resolution feature must be disabled for a manual resolution to take effect.
Checks if unsupported Windows compatibility options are enabled for sh2pc.exe and disables them.
Removes unneeded Windows Virtual Store files for the game and checks if administrator access is required (and prompts for UAC, if needed) upon launch, in order to save game progress.
Disables the screensaver in Windows while the game is running.

Silent Hill 2: Enhanced Edition will read and use files in the "sh2e" folder, rather than the "data" folder, whenever possible. This allows custom, modified game files to be stored in the "sh2e" folder so as not to replace/overwrite original game files, which are found in the "data" folder. Any game files which we have not modified will still be read from the "data" folder like normal, so you must keep the "data" folder and leave it untouched.
Removes the CD check on some versions of the game. Not guaranteed to work on all executables.
Disables Microsoft Game Explorer (GameUX.dll) to prevent the game hanging on launch and rundll32.exe high CPU usage.
Fixes issues for Nvidia graphics cards, such as missing/incorrect shadows, when force-enabling anti-aliasing through of your GPU's control panel.
Limits the game to one CPU core. Note: If the value is set to a number that is greater than the available cores on your computer, it will default to using the first core (CPU 0).
Assign multiple functions to the same input
Controller type for search cam movement
Allows the D-pad on DirecInput gamepads to act as an additional movement pad to control James and to be used to navigate menu selections.
Allows the same controller input to be assigned to multiple game functions.
Restores right joystick functionality for controllers to move the search camera around. Change the setting depending on what type of controller you are using.
Swaps left joystick/D-pad and right joystick functions. Useful for left-handed players.
Sets what pad (controller) ID to vibrate.

Upon game launch, the SH2 Enhancements module will check for updates and, if available, will ask the user if they would like to update their files to receive new improvements and features for this module. Note: The SH2 Enhancements module can only update itself. This updater does not update any other enhancement package.
Loads ASI plugins only from the "scripts" and "plugins" folders.
Loads d3d8.dll from the "scripts" and "plugins" folders. Requires d3d8to9 = 0 to work.
Disable large, floating save menu text
Restore all languages in options menu
Restores the thickness, size, and amount of fog to its original appearance.
Fixes an issue on Nvidia graphics cards where the 2D fog layer and the glow around James' flashlight is missing.
Adjusts the fog-of-war boundaries for specific areas to fix visual errors.
Adjusts the speed of the fog for slower, more natural movement to better match the PlayStation 2 version.

Uses custom font files to produce high-resolution text in-game. Compatible with all preset language files (English, French, German, Italian, and Spanish) in the game. Note: fontwdata.bin and font000.tga files must be present in "sh2e\font\" for this feature to work.
Disables the enlarged, floating/overlaid game file text while navigating the save/load menu. Requires high resolution text to be enabled to work.
Fixes the mouse hitboxes for the game's main menu selections for the North American version 1.1 executable.
Loads translated main menu text selections for the North American version 1.0 and 1.1 executables. Note: "start01*.tex" files must be present in "sh2e\pic\etc\"" for this feature to work.
Disables the screen position feature in the game's options menu, which is no longer needed for modern displays.

Disables changing the speaker configuration feature in the game's options menu, as after Windows XP this change must be done through Windows' sound control panel and can no longer be changed within the game. Note: d3d8.res must be present in the game's directory for this feature to work.

Restores all language options (English, French, German, Italian, and Spanish) as selectable choices and creates language-specific pause menu text for the North American executables of the game. Note: d3d8.res must be present in the game's directory for this feature to work.
Unlocks the ability to select Japanese for the game's text/subtitles. Note: It is recommended to keep this disabled for now, as not all Japanese characters are currently supported.
Allows higher quality sound files to be used. Must be enabled if using the Audio Enhancement Pack.
Detects when any audio event is stopped prematurely and fades out the sound to avoid "popping/clicking" that would otherwise be heard.
Allows higher quality, upscaled images to be used.

Enabling this feature sets the 2D, full screen images to their original aspect ratios. This will remove stretching on the images, when played in widescreen. Disabling this feature stretches the images to fit the screen. This affects all full screen images, such as the main menu, save screens, memo/riddle images, and inventory screen, along with other textures such as subtitles and the flashlight lens glow.
Increases the speed of all fade out/fade in transitions. Examples include going between rooms, opening/closing the inventory screen, examining memo/riddle images, and saving.
Prevents the player from bringing up the PC pause menu during a fade-in, which would otherwise use the wrong screen grab of the game for the pause menu background image.
Chainsaw only spawns on New Game+
Correctly fade images from memo list
Fix enemy spawn in Wood Side Room 205
Fix Lying Figures exiting from under vehicles
Fix town west back alley gate commentary
Corrects color and level values for the Catacomb's meat cold rooms.
Prevents the chainsaw from spawning on a first playthrough, which is a developer-intended design choice.
Creates a local.fix file in the game's directory (if it does not already exist) to allow GPU-based anti-aliasing support for the game.
Fixes an issue where the top-most layer of memo images would not correctly fade/darken with the rest of the image when viewed through your memos list.
Prevents the game from using the lowest visual settings upon relaunch, if the game crashed previously.
Disables Windows' high DPI scaling for the game to prevent certain display issues, such as a "burnt-in" image from appearing during fade transitions.
Restores soft shadows, shadow level intensities, shadow fading on flashlight toggles, and self shadows.
Allows the game to correctly check free disk space in hard drives larger than 2TB in order to save game files.
Fixes the flashlight rendering on the apartment grandfather clock at the end of the failed attempt to push it.

Darkens the closet bars and moves the noise grain layer to be on top of the closet bar blur layer during the first-person segment of the apartment closet cutscene to match the PlayStation 2 version. Also adjusts the visuals during another camera cut to better light the scene.
Increases the camera speed movement to match the PlayStation 2 version, and removes "floaty/bouncy" camera behavior that was present in the PC version.
Removes flicker from environment settings resetting to default values at the end of certain cutscenes.
Fixes a rare bug where the Mannequin creature in Woodside Apartments Room 205 may not spawn/behave correctly upon entering the room.

Adjusts the flashlight's brightness to resemble the PlayStation 2 version by reducing its intensity for environments, but keeping enemies and NPCs bright. Also corrects flashlight levels for Woodside Apartment Room 205 (the flashlight and mannequin room), along with a handful of other specialized rooms.
Fixes a bug that would make James' body flash with light if exiting the pause menu while the flashlight is off.
Correctly syncs Red Pyramid Thing's attack animation to the rest of the cutscene that plays out during the hospital elevator chase sequence.
Fixes an issue where Lying Figures would exit from underneath vehicles incorrectly.
Fixes an issue on Nvidia graphics cards where chunks of the wall would disappear if the camera got to close to the geometry when using a 16:9 aspect ratio.
Hides a piston behind the wall that would otherwise be seen when Angela opens the door in the Labyrinth during a cutscene.
Removes flicker that appears at the beginning of any motion blur event.
Disables free-saving in select rooms that would cause game issues upon file loading back into the rooms. Addresses quick save bugs that could otherwise soft lock the game.
Changes James' commentary about the back alley Heaven's Night gate at night to properly reflect the gate's status.
Prevents distracting shadow flickering along the patio glass doors while in Room 312 of the Hotel, and restores the chair's shadow during the cutscene that takes place in this room.
Increases the blood pool size of dead enemies back to their original amount.
Increases the front draw distance in certain areas to hide the environment loading in.
Restores proper environmental settings for the "Maria" ending, and restores lighting conditions for the 3D trees in the "Leave" and "Maria" ending.
Fixes an issue where some light sources would not properly brighten and darken James.
Removes flicker when accessing the pause menu and restores the noise filter and bloom effects in the pause menu for Room 312 of the Hotel.
Forces all dynamically made pillarboxing to be black in color, restores pillarboxing to events which did not have them, and hides map markings behind the pillarboxing.
Restores post-processing effects to their original intensities. Effects include depth-of-field blur, motion blur, static blur, and pseudo blooms.
Use PS2 low res main menu screen

Restores specularity and specular behavior throughout the game. This gives "shininess" to things such as character eyeballs, Pyramid Head's helmet, Maria's skirt, etc. And shiny things will shine brighter whenever they're under a light source or when James' flashlight is on.
Restores illuminance for certain environment assets.
Restores lighting values for the water throughout the game.

Prevents the game from using wrong environmental and fog lighting values in the cemetery, if you load back into this area from a save point. Also corrects lighting levels in various other rooms/areas.
Fixes an issue with James' character model being placed erratically into the rowboat if you previously entered the rowboat then load an earlier save point to enter the rowboat again.
Prevents a crash when Steam controller configuration is used or when going to the game's options menu while using certain types of gamepads.
Thickens the horizontal line in the hospital diary text to make it easier to see at higher rendering resolutions.
Disables the "sh2e\pic\"" path and redirects to "sh2e\ps2\" to use the original, low resolution full screen images. This will disable all images found within the "sh2e\pic\" path.
Fixes an issue on Nvidia graphics cards where certain areas would appear white when they should be black.
